extended_metaphor.metaphor: Both Adrenal Glands in endocrine system and Central Banking in money have a feedback control mechanism
extended_metaphor.adrenal_glands: Adrenal Glands in the endocrine system maintain homeostasis by dynamically responding to external stressors and internal conditions through interconnected sensors and actuators.
extended_metaphor.central_banking: Similarly, Central Banking in money operates by maintaining financial stability through dynamic responses to external economic stressors and internal conditions using interconnected monitoring tools and policy interventions.

extended_metaphor.metaphor: Both Adrenal Glands in endocrine system and Central Banking in money have a sensor-actuator system
extended_metaphor.adrenal_glands: Adrenal Glands utilize specialized receptors interconnected with actuators to detect changes in stress levels, metabolism, and blood pressure efficiently.
extended_metaphor.central_banking: In the same way, Central Banking relies on a network of sensors and actuators to continuously monitor indicators such as inflation, interest rates, and economic growth, enabling swift interventions to maintain financial stability.

extended_metaphor.metaphor: Both Adrenal Glands in endocrine system and Central Banking in money have efficient communication
extended_metaphor.adrenal_glands: Adrenal Glands are strategically located within the body to facilitate rapid communication and response in order to maintain balance.
extended_metaphor.central_banking: Central Banking is strategically positioned in the financial system to ensure efficient communication and coordination among various institutions and markets, enabling quick responses to economic challenges and maintaining stability.
